newsitem.title: USA: Dayton Hudson April same-store sales rise.
newsitem.headline: Dayton Hudson April same-store sales rise.

text.p: Dayton Hudson Corp said Thursday its same store sales for the four weeks ended May 3, 1997 rose 2.9 percent from the comparable period a year ago.
Total sales in April increased 8.4 percent to $1.769 billion from $1.632 billion a year ago, the giant retailer said.
Dayton Hudson currently operates 1,092 stores in 39 states. This includes 752 Target stores, 276 Mervyn's stores and 64 Department Stores.
"April sales were essentially on plan at Target, but below expectations at Mervyn's and the Department Stores," said Bob Ulrich, chairman and chief executive officer of Dayton Hudson, in a statement.
April and year-to-date sales by operating division were as follows:

-- Target's total sales for the month increased 15.6 percent and comparable-store sales increased 6.7 percent. Year-to-date, Target's total sales increased 13.8 percent and comparable-store sales increased 5.2 percent.

-- Mervyn's total sales for the month decreased 11.4 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 6.2 percent. Year-to-date, Mervyn's total sales decreased 4.1 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 2.3 percent.

-- The Department Store Division's total sales for the month decreased 2.9 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 6.1 percent. Year-to-date, the Department Stores total sales decreased 0.4 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 3.3 percent.

Total company sales for the 13 weeks ended May 3, 1997 were $5.74 billion, up 8.9 percent from $5.27 billion in the same period a year ago. Comparable-store sales for the 13-week period were up 2.9 percent compared to the same period last year.
"We continue to anticipate strong earnings in the first quarter," Ulrich said.

Earlier this month, Ulrich said he expected first quarter earnings to exceed analysts' consensus estimates of $0.33 a share and cited strength in the company's Target stores. In 1996 first quarter, Dayton Hudson earned $0.16 a share.
